extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 lbs skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 4 fillets

recipes.title: Creamy Dijon Chicken â€“ 5 Points

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Beautiful and golden in color, this chardonnay has persistent ripe pear and lychee flavors that are complemented by a subtle, sweet toasty oak. Very balanced acid harmonizes the thick viscosity of this ripe and decadent wine.

recipes.instructions: InstructionsSeason both sides of the chicken with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a medium sized skillet, over medium high heat.When oil begins to smoke, add in chicken and sear on both sides (about 2-4 minutes per side).Turn heat to medium low, and whisk together remaining ingredients in a bowl. Then pour over chicken, cover with a lid, and cook until chicken is no longer pink and is thoroughly cooked through, about 8-10 minutes.

steps.step: Season both sides of the chicken with salt and pepper.

Heat oil in a medium sized skillet, over medium high heat.When oil begins to smoke, add in chicken and sear on both sides (about 2-4 minutes per side).Turn heat to medium low, and whisk together remaining ingredients in a bowl. Then pour over chicken, cover with a lid, and cook until chicken is no longer pink and is thoroughly cooked through, about 8-10 minutes.
